revised_title: Anatomy and Habitat of the Dugong
tldr: The author describes the physical characteristics, anatomy, and habitat of the Dugong, a marine mammal resembling cetaceans. They provide details on the Dugong's diet, skeletal structure, and behavior, as well as its preferred location in the sea. The Dugong is found in shallow waters and inlets, particularly near the mouth of the Johore river in Southeast Asia.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Mammalogy
